DataElement.preferredName: Patient Questionnaire Complete Eligibility Determination Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a patient or participant can complete study questionnaires, a set of questions or items shown to a respondent in order to get answers for research purposes, as part of the act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a patient or participant completing study questionnaires, a set of questions or items shown to a respondent in order to get answers for research purposes, as part of the act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument.:Complete; having every necessary or normal part or component or step; or having come or been brought to a conclusion.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: English speaking participants
ReferenceDocuments.description: English speaking participants must have the ability to complete questionnaire(s) by themselves or with assistance

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Ability to complete questionnaire(s) by themselves or with assistance

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Willing and able to complete QOL by themselves or with assistance

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Ability to complete patient diaries and questionnaire(s) by themselves or with assistance

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: After informed consent is obtained from the patient and prior to starting the treatment, baseline PRO-CTCAE assessments and QOL questionnaires must be completed.  Blood and tissue samples should be obtained prior to treatment.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was parent/guardian able to complete the parent-report measures in English?

ReferenceDocuments.name: eligibility
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient willing and able to check and record daily blood pressure readings?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have receptive and expressive language skills in English, French, or Spanish to complete the QoL and Neurocognitive assessments?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was parent/guardian able to complete the parent-report measures?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: The patient is willing and able to complete the EPIC quality of life questionnaire

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Subjects or authorized representative must be willing to complete a detailed questionnaire in English.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have receptive and expressive language skills in English or Spanish to complete the QOL and Neurocognitive assessments?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patient Eligibility Questionnaire regarding household income
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient is willing to provide answers on the Patient Eligibility Questionnaire regarding household income.

ReferenceDocuments.name: EAQ171CD
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient complete the Baseline Survey in EASEE-PRO within 1 month (30 days) of the date of Informed Consent (Step 1)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 001
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was a parent or guardian able to complete the parent-report assessments?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient complete the Baseline Survey in EASEE-PRO within 30 days of the date of Step 0 registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Can the participant answer surveys in English?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Can the participant answer surveys in English or Spanish?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient complete the Baseline Survey in EASEE-PRO within 30 days of the date of informed consent and registration to Step 0?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient complete the Baseline Survey in EASEE-PRO within 30 days of step 0 registration date?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Can the participant complete surveys in English or Spanish?
